Title: Great Camera
Cons: None
Pros: Love this camera, if fact I bought another one when my old one was stolen.  High res photos, very durable, this thing takes the Best pictures!  I'm a Realtor and I use this camera daily.  The software is easy to use and teh camera well worth the price!

Title: A Rugged, Weather Proof Digital Camera for Outdoor Photography
Cons:
The 1/2.35" CCD image sensor is relatively small and for low-light situations can produce noisy pictures if short exposures are made.

For bright daylight use, the screen is not bright enough and itâ€™s hard to frame pictures with this camera.

The Li-50 battery is a proprietary size, expensive to replace and relatively difficult to locate.

Does not come with an xD memory card.  

xD memory cards are confusing if you are not experienced.  A 2GB xD Type-M card is OK for still photography. For video capture, xD Type-H memory cards are necessary. Type-H memory cards are hard to find.
Pros:
This is a very compact, rugged, water-resistant digital camera for outdoor use. This camera has a sophisticated exposure system which allows the user considerable flexibility in producing properly exposed outdoor/indoor shots. Camera is easy to use. It has menu-driven scene mode for preset exposure control, or manual mode for finer exposure control.  Camera is really optimized for daylight outdoor photography, though it is capable of producing acceptable indoor images provided the flash is used or exposure times are sufficiently long.  Color rendition and saturation is excellent.  Image resolution is excellent and on 8x10 paper with shows no noticeable granularity.

OLYMPUS image processing software is provided which I found easy to use and OK. This software does a good job managing, converting and editing images from this camera. This software can convert to various image formats and resolutions. And has not slowed down or harmed my XP Home computer (not spyware/bloatware)
Comments:
I am well satisfied with this camera and feel comfortable recommending this camera to friends with one caveat: this camera is not intended to replace a digital SLR camera if you want superior image quality and maximum versatility for indoor photography.

This is my first digital camera.  I am a 35 year veteran of 35mm film SLR photography. A compact digital camera took time to feel comfortable and competent.  I have owned this camera for nearly a year and have enough experience form a very positive opinion.  

Digital photography beats film photography because I do not have to deal with time-consuming darkroom work.  Just download, view, crop and print the images on the PC.

This camera is definitely rugged, waterproof and can withstand cold. I use this camera outdoors on hikes or cross-country ski trips in the Adirondacks were the climate can become very cold in the winter, and very wet and humid in the summer.  Camera withstood this and functioned very well.

Title: Fantastic Little Camera
Cons: Compared to Professional Grade DSLR cameras the pictures may be slightly fuzzy, or have a yellow hue.  Turning off the auto white balance generally will fix the yellow problem.  As for the fuzzy pictures,  You can't notice it with the naked eye, even on an 8x10 enlargement.  Only con... focus is a little slow in 15 feet of water (but what do you expect?)
Pros: We bought this camera for a trip to Hawaii.  Performed like a champ!!  It handled the abuse from all 9 of the people on our trip.  At the end we had taken more than 1800  (not typo, yes 1800)  All but a few dozen turned out fantastic!
Comments: For the abuse we put this camera through:  High temp, freezing (Brother was being stupid and hid it in the freezer just because he could).  Hot tub, to ocean.  The camera survived it all and is still our favorite point and shoot.  We only pull out the DSLR now when we do our studio shoots, or family portraits.

Title: It is not waterproof and bad painted
Cons: At the First day of my Hawaiian vacation all black color been washed out with ocean water without any efforts from my side. Just piece by piece it has gone. On Third day I already looked for another underwater camera and did write letter to Olympus Repair Service ( 6 days ago - no answer yet). What's happened, you'll ask? Nothing :(( just a small protection shield on lens been dropped down ( clued off) when I had snorkeling on water ( no any dive been done deeper then 5-6 ft) and water from all Pacific ocean leaked into camera, because this small protection shield cloaking seal which protects electronic board. What I felt those time  - you 'll better never feel. And definitely, first idea was to write the letter to Olympus team. Probably it happened before Christmas, I got a wrong idea that Great Olympus Santa will send me another camera and I will happy like a child...But, I'll tell you a secret - there is no Santa in Olympus ( and probably in the world as well).
Pros: Good opportunity take underwater pictures and QVGA movies, but not a long time...
Comments: I found in local W...l-Mart on Kauai OLympus Stylus 850, because here is not a big selection of waterproof cameras and I'll tell you that as per my ( and my family's) opinion, 850 is better.

Title: Going to the Carribian? Buy one
Cons: optical zoom could be better
Pros: great picture quality, amazing underwater photos, extremely tough exterior, lens is good, works in saltwater as well as freshwater with no need to worry about corrosion (as long as you follow directions including rinsing of the camera after use within an hour) overall a spectacular buy
Comments: if you want a camera that can take photos under water...can be dropped from eye level and that most people can stand on without the camera breaking this is the row to hoe

Title: Nice Camera, when it works
Cons:
I went diving in the Bahamas with this thing, and it broke within 10ft of depth (rated to 33ft). I had to send it back to get fixed (pay for shipping), and had to buy a new battery which wasn't covered under the warranty. So beware.

It seems to be working fine though now.
Pros: I find the picture/video quality to be pretty good. Its a slim camera that obviously feels very durable. The zoom isn't that bad considered its all internal.

Title: Sweet deal!
Cons: Battery runs out fairly fast, so you'll want to use the power save option (although this may cause you to miss a photo opportunity), and the battery must be taken out of the camera to be charged (no power cord).  The auto-focus kind of sucks, but what would you expect with a point and shoot?  The panorama also doesn't work quite as expected--you're better off with a good eye and some Photoshop skills.  Screen is kind of hard to see in strong daylight.  Delay from pressing the capture button to when the photo is shot is kind of slow--like most digital cameras.  Remedy this by using the hi-speed shutter setting.
Pros: Water proof, shock proof, freeze proof, ninja proof, beer proof.  It takes super huge pictures (10.1 mp is nice!), has some neat-o features, and is durable as all get out.  Get the super huge 2gb m+ flash memory card, and you'll be able to take hundreds of pictures on the highest setting, or thousands on the lowest!  The little LED light is super helpful.
Comments: You have to get used to this camera.  It's kind of picky, but if you get the settings right and you know how to time and light your shots, you'll do well.  It's super awesome to joke around with people and drop it in your beer or the water or something.  You may also want to get a screen guard for the LCD--I scratched the hell out of mine going on adventures!  Overall-SUPER AWESOME BUY!

Title: SMOOTH
Cons: NONE at the moment but if it doesn't stand up to the environment of a Marine in Afghanistan, you will know.
Pros: This is my second Olympus digital camera and all I can say about the Stylus 1030 SW is that its SMOOTH. The features are amazing (compare the features to any other digital camera and you will see that the Stylus 1030 SW is the REAL DEAL) and I will test the durabilities here in Afghanistan. I had the the Stylus 730 and it fell from about 4ft and the LCD monitor crack. Olympus has a winner in the Stylus 1030 SW. The Stylus 1030 SW is money well spent.
Comments: The weight of this camera is a bit heavy for a small digital camera but I guess it has to be to withstand 6ft drop. I am using the type H XD picture card and it does not support the  panoramic features so GET the type M+ card.  Thank you NEWEGG for the great price and quality.

Title: Awesome Little Camera
Cons:
Autofocus is a little too slow in low light situations (not totally unreasonable performance).  
The lens is a little "soft" for my taste, but slight sharpening with photo editing tool produces brilliant pictures.
Pros:
This is my new favorite camera, we purchased this for a trip to Hawaii this summer.  Performed flawlessly.  Underwater shots were full of color and very clear.  
I'm very much a klutz and have dropped this camera more than once, very rugged.  Even survived a canoe trip with the boy scouts!
Comments: Most problems reported by this camera are from people that didn't read the manual.   Make sure when you order extra memory for this cammera you get the XD M+ type (or some advanced features are disabled)

Cons: none.
Pros: Takes awesome pictures.  Lots of features.  Camera is very solid and has a good feel to it.  LCD screen is great.  Battery life is great.  Underwater pictures turn out fine.

Title: Great Camera
Cons: None
Pros: Love this camera, if fact I bought another one when my old one was stolen.  High res photos, very durable, this thing takes the Best pictures!  I'm a Realtor and I use this camera daily.  The software is easy to use and teh camera well worth the price!
